Fishery officers were recently called to this illegal net on a lake in the South‚Ä¶

urls.title: Peak Forest Canal. Between Bridges 29 Bank End Bridge & Bridge 28, Thornsett Road Bridge | Canal & River Trust
urls.description: Please be advised navigation is currently closed at Bridge 29, Bank End Bridge on the Peak Forest canal due to a pollution incident. Our local team are on site installing booms at the bridge to contain the pollution.

text: Sadly we can believe that @thameswater is letting #sewage flow into one of the @Chilternstreams it has undertaken to protect and restore. @DefraGovUK & the @EnvAgency is letting them get away with under-investing in essential infrastructure yet again. Same on the @RiverThameCT https://t.co/I8fqqhUQlQ

Our Chairman, Paul Rice, will be meeting with a rep from the @EnvAgency  at  this week to advise them about breaches & issues with the flood alleviation scheme.
He will also have a Zoom meeting  with the local MP and others to discuss housing and flooding across North Norfolk.
